column5: CAPE CANAVERAL  Fla. Sept 24 Aerojet Rocketdyne Holdings Inc will pay Orbital ATK $50 million to settle a dispute stemming from an Antares rocket launch accident last year that destroyed a load of cargo bound for the International Space Station  Aerojet said on Thursday.

column4: Aerojet to pay Orbital $50 million over Antares rocket accident
column5: Aerojet Rocketdyne Holdings Inc will pay Orbital ATK $50 million to settle a dispute stemming from an Antares rocket launch accident last year that destroyed a load of cargo bound for the International Space Station  Aerojet said on Thursday.

column4: Former Petrobras executive mentions Transocean in graft probe
column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 24 Transocean Ltd.  a top offshore drilling company  has been mentioned in testimony in a corruption investigation focused on Brazil's state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA  Brazilian court documents showed.

column4: Brazil CDS at highest since crisis as sell-off deepens
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 24 (IFR) - The gloom hanging over Brazil deepened on Thursday as the ongoing sell-off pushed the sovereign's credit default swaps past 500bp  their highest level since the financial crisis.

column4: Brazil Supreme Court votes to spin off part of corruption probe
column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 23 Brazil's Supreme Court voted on Wednesday to move part of the country's largest-ever corruption probe to another judge  challenging the notion that all pieces of a case that initially focused on state-run oil firm Petrobras are legally linked.

column4: BRIEF-Alphaform sells selected assets and operations to Proto Labs
column5: * Has reached an agreement in principle with Proto Labs  Inc. on key terms and conditions of a sale of selected assets and operations to Proto Labs

column4: UPDATE 1-Schlumberger does not intend to extend agreement to buy stake in Eurasia
column5: MOSCOW  Sept 24 U.S. company Schlumberger said on Thursday it does not intend to extend the pending agreement to acquire a minority equity interest in Eurasia Drilling once the current extension expires on Sept. 30.

column4: Schlumberger does not intend to extend agreement to buy stake in Eurasia
column5: MOSCOW  Sept 24 U.S. company Schlumberger said on Thursday it does not intend to extend the pending agreement to acquire a minority equity interest in Eurasia Drilling once the current extension expires on Sept. 30.

column4: SK Telecom says to buy back $438 mln worth of own shares
column5: SEOUL  Sept 24 South Korean mobile carrier SK Telecom Co Ltd said on Thursday that it will buy back 523 billion won ($438.21 million) worth of its own shares in order to boost shareholder value.

column4: Sprint could be 'formidable' after merger with cable company  CEO says
column5: NEW YORK Sprint Corp  could be stronger if merged with a cable company  the U.S wireless company's chief executive said on Thursday  adding that he was not engaged in any such merger talks.

column4: Sprint unveils $1 plan ahead of new iPhone launch
column5: Sprint Corp announced a $1 per month plan for Apple Inc's new iPhone  upping the ante in a battle among top U.S. carriers to sign up customers ahead of the phone's launch on Friday.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 1-Sprint unveils $1 plan ahead of new iPhone launch
column5: Sept 24 Sprint Corp announced a $1 per month plan for Apple Inc's new iPhone  upping the ante in a battle among top U.S. carriers to sign up customers ahead of the phone's launch on Friday.

column4: Sprint unveils $1 plan for new iPhones
column5: Sept 24 Sprint Corp announced a $1 per month plan for Apple Inc's new iPhone  upping the ante in a battle among top U.S. carriers to sign up customers ahead of the phone's launch on Friday.

column4: U.S. court denies FTC request to stop Steris-Synergy merger
column5: WASHINGTON A federal court in Ohio refused on Thursday to stop a $1.9 billion purchase by U.S. medical technology provider Steris Corp of British sterilization services provider Synergy Health Plc  despite the objections of U.S. antitrust enforcers.

column4: Court denies U.S. request to stop merger of Steris  Synergy Health
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 24 A federal court in Ohio refused on Thursday to stop a $1.9 billion merger of medical technology provider Steris Corp and British sterilization services provider Synergy Health Plc  despite the objections of U.S. antitrust enforcers.

column4: Taiwan stocks led up by TSMC  but early gains slip ahead of rate meeting
column5: TAIPEI  Sept 24 Taiwan shares were higher on Thursday led by TSMC announcing its third quarter revenue would be better than expected and on bargain-hunting after sharp losses in the previous session.

column4: Target appoints new operations leader to identify customer needs faster
column5: CHICAGO Target Corp on Thursday appointed Anu Gupta to a newly created operational role that is expected to help the retailer  anticipate customer needs quickly.

column5: CHICAGO  Sept 24 Target Corp on Thursday appointed Anu Gupta to a newly created operational role that is expected to help the retailer  anticipate customer needs quickly.

column4: Pacific trade pact negotiators move closer to deal on rules for autos
column5: Japan  the United States  Mexico and Canada are moving closer to a deal on rules for the automotive industry in a landmark Pacific trade deal  a leading obstacle to agreement on the 12-nation pact  officials briefed on the talks said on Wednesday.`

column4: UPDATE 1-TransCanada says cutting 20 percent of senior management positions
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Sept 24 Pipeline company TransCanada Corp will cut 20 percent of its senior management positions as a continuing slump in oil prices has necessitated cost reductions  with further staff cuts possible in the future  a company spokesman said on Thursday.

column4: EU mergers and takeovers (Sept 24)
column5: BRUSSELS  Sept 24 The following are mergers under review by the European Commission and a brief guide to the EU merger process:

column4: Brazil's Vale approves Jennifer Maki as base metals head
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Sept 24 Brazilian miner Vale SA  said on Thursday it approved the election of Jennifer Maki as executive director of the company's base metals division.

column4: Exclusive: Wal-Mart presses suppliers to share benefits of cheaper yuan
column5: CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc  is seeking price cuts from suppliers that produce goods in China  saying the retailer should share in the savings generated by China's devaluation of the yuan  people with knowledge of the matter said.

column4: Wells Fargo has biggest energy exposure among large U.S. banks: Raymond James
column5: Wells Fargo & Co  has the largest exposure to loans to energy companies among major U.S. lenders  a report from Raymond James said  amid concerns that banks may have to set aside more money to cover bad loans to the industry.
